mmud.commands

Interface Command

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AcceptCommand, AdminCommand, ApplyCommand, AskCommand, BogusCommand, BowCommand, BuyCommand, ChangeMasterCommand, ClearCommand, CloseCommand, CommunicationCommand, ConditionCommand, CryCommand, CurtseyCommand, DateCommand, DestroyCommand, DetailsCommand, DisarmCommand, DownCommand, DrinkCommand, DropCommand, EastCommand, EatCommand, EmotionCommand, EmotionToCommand, EyebrowCommand, GetCommand, GiveCommand, GoCommand, GuildCommand, GuildMasterCommand, HelpCommand, InventoryCommand, ItemCommand, LeaveCommand, LockCommand, LookAtCommand, LookCommand, LookInCommand, MacroCommand, MeCommand, MessageCommand, NormalCommand, NorthCommand, OpenCommand, PostBoardCommand, PutCommand, ReadBoardCommand, ReadCommand, RejectCommand, RemoveCommand, RetrieveCommand, SayCommand, ScreamCommand, ScriptCommand, SellCommand, ShoutCommand, SingCommand, SleepCommand, SouthCommand, StatsCommand, TargetCommand, TellCommand, TimeCommand, UndressCommand, UnlockCommand, UnwearCommand, UnwieldCommand, UpCommand, WearCommand, WestCommand, WhisperCommand, WhoCommand, WieldCommand, WimpyCommand

    public interface Command
    The interface used for all commands to be executed. Commands are executed by characters. Bear in mind that commands are static classes devoid of state.
    Author:
    maartenl

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getRegExpr()
      returns the regular expression the command structure must follow.
      DisplayInterface run(String command, User aUser)
      Runs the command.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        DisplayInterface run(String command,
                   User aUser)
                     throws MudException
        Runs the command. The usual sequence of events is:
        • parsing the command string
        • retrieving the appropriate information items/rooms/characters/etc)
        • doing the action
        • composing a return message for the user.
        Parameters:
        command - the String containing the full command.
        aUser - the user that is executing the command
        Returns:
        DisplayInterface to display to the user, if it returns null, it means the command was unsuccessfull.
        Throws:
        MudException - if something goes wrong.

      • getRegExpr

        String getRegExpr()
        returns the regular expression the command structure must follow.
        Returns:
        String containing the regular expression.
